questions.stem: Which of the following is true about the Widal test for typhoid fever?
options: Antibodies begin to rise on the 2nd day of the disease.
It is used for the diagnosis of Cholera.
It has a diagnostic titer in endemic areas.
Repeated testing is necessary to demonstrate a rising titer, which is diagnostic.

questions.stem: Specific prevention for typhoid fever includes:
What is the proper procedure for contacts of a typhoid fever case who work as food handlers?
options: Require surveillance for two weeks from the date of last exposure.
Require isolation for two weeks from the date of last exposure.
Require segregation and bacteriological examination until proven not to be carriers.
Allow them to work but require bacteriological examination.

questions.stem: Which of the following is a strictly zoonotic disease?
Seroprophylaxis (the use of antiserum) is available for which of the following?
options: All causative agents of infectious food poisoning

questions.stem: After Polio infection, involvement of the Central Nervous System (CNS) occurs in approximately what percentage of infected persons?
Which of the following food-borne infections has an animal reservoir?
Which is the only reservoir for Typhoid fever?
options: Man: case and all types of carriers

questions.stem: In typhoid fever, a positive blood culture in the first week is conclusive but not exclusive.
Hepatitis A infection, whether clinical or subclinical, confers long-life immunity.
No measures are needed for human contacts of a case of brucellosis.
Salk vaccine is a live attenuated vaccine used for the specific prevention of Cholera.
